name: Pan-Seared Salmon with Wasabi Dressing and Bok Choy
author: Dara
summary: Excellent meal with complementary flavors. Best paired with rice.
ingredients: salt and ground black pepper to taste
2  scallions, thinly sliced, whites and greens separated
2 heads   bok choy, ends trimmed and leaves separated
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Combine mayonnaise, lime juice, wasabi paste, 1 clove garlic, and 1/2 teaspoon ginger in a small bowl
Add just enough water to give dressing a drizzling consistency
Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a 12-inch skillet over medium heat
Add white parts of the scallions, 2 cloves garlic, and 1/2 teaspoon ginger
Add bok choy and 1 tablespoon water
Cook until leaves wilt, about 3 minutes
Transfer bok choy mixture to a plate
Heat remaining 1 tablespoon oil in the same skillet over medium-high heat
Pat salmon dry with paper towels; season with salt and pepper
Place salmon skin-side down in the skillet
Cook until skin is crispy, about 6 minutes
Flip salmon and reduce heat to medium
Cook until flesh is opaque, about 4 minutes more
Transfer salmon to serving plates; drizzle wasabi dressing on top
Garnish with green parts of the scallions
